resources.string: Learn Kannada (Kannada Kali)
Settings
Welcome to Kannada Kali
Test Text
Eng : Learn Kannada.\nKan : Kannada kali .
Eng : I am Saraswathi.\nKan : Naanu Saraswathi.
Eng : We are Indians.\nKan : Naavu bhaaratheeyaru.
Eng : My name is Lakshmi.\nKan : Nanna hesaru Lakshmi.
Eng : Our country is India.\nKan : Namma dEsha Bhaaratha
Eng : This is for us.\nKan : idu namage.
Eng : This is for me.\nKan : idu nanage.
Eng : This pen is mine.\nKan : ee pen nannadu.
Eng : This place is ours.\nKan : ee jaaga nammadu.
Eng : You are my friend.\nKan : Neenu nanna gelaya.
Eng : You are my teacher.\nKan : Neevu nanna guru.
Eng : This is your book.\nKan : idu ninna pusthaka.
Eng : These are your books.\nKan : ivu nimma pusthakagalu.
Eng : This book is for you.\nKan : ee pusthaka ninage.
Eng : These books are for you.\nKan : ee pusthakagalu nimage.
Eng : This phone is yours.\nKan : ee phone ninnadu.
Eng : This place is yours.\nKan : ee jaaga nimmadu.
Eng : He is a cricket player\nKan : Avanu obba cricket aatagaara
Eng : She is a good girl\nKan : AvaLu oLLe hudugi
Eng : They are cricket player(s)\nKan : Avaru cricket aatagaara(ru)
Eng : This is his book OR This book is his\nKan : idu avana Pusthaka athavaa ee pustaka avanadu
Eng : This is her book OR This book is hers\nKan : idu avaLa Pusthaka athavaa ee pustaka avaLadu
Eng : This is their house OR This house is theirs\nKan : idu avara mane OR ee mane avaradu
Eng : This sweet is for him\nKan : ee sweet(sihi) avanige
Eng : This box is for her\nKan : ee box(Dabba) avaLige
Eng : This gift is for them\nKan : ee gift(uDugore) avarige
Eng : This is Bengaluru\nKan : idu Bengaluru
Eng : That is Mysuru\nKan : adu Mysuru
Eng : Your book is there\nKan : nimma pusthaka alli ide
Eng : Bottle is here\nKan : Bottle illi ide
Eng : Where is my car?\nKan : nanna car elli ide?
Eng : Why are you late?\nKan : neenu late(taDa) yaake?
Eng : What is your name?\nKan : ninna hesaru Enu?
Eng : How did it happen?\nKan : idu hEge aayitu(happen)?
Eng : Which is your bag?\nKan : ninna cheela(bag) yaavudu?
Eng : Whom to give this?\nKan : idu yaarige kodabeku?
Eng : Whose pen is this?\nKan : ee pen yaaradu?
Eng : When did you come to the office?\nKan : neenu kachEri(office)ge yaavaaga bande?
Eng : Who are you?\nKan : neenu yaaru?
Eng : Hi! How are you?\nKan : namaskaara! hege iddera (hEgidira)?
Eng : Welcome to the dance programme.\nKan : nrutya kaaryakramakke suswaagata.
Eng : Good Morning! Had breakfast?\nKan : Shubhodaya! thindi ayta?
Eng : Good Evening! Had coffee?\nKan : Shubhasanje! coffee ayta?
Eng : Good Night! Have a tight sleep\nKan : Shubharaatri! nidde(sleep) channagi madi
Eng : I am leaving… see you soon!\nKan : naanu hogutha ideeni. Matte sigoNa!
Eng : Thank you for your help!\nKan : nimma sahaayakke dhanyavaadagaLu (help - sahaaya)
Eng : How was the breakfasti>?\nKan : thinDi hege itthu (hegitthu)?
Eng : Lunch/Dinner was very good\nKan : Uta thumba channagi itthu.
Eng : You go, I will come\nKan : neenu hOgu, naanu barteeni
Eng : You please go first\nKan : neevu dayavittu(Please) modalu(first) hOgi
Eng : Brother, come here!\nKan : thamma! ba illi
Eng : Hi Madam! Please come inside\nKan : namaskaara Madam! dayavittu oLage banni
Eng : I will eat now\nKan : naanu eega tinnu(eat)theNe
Eng : I will do it later\nKan : naanu adanna aamEle maadu(Do)thene
Eng : I am working from home today!\nKan : naanu ivattu mane inda kelsa madutta ideeni
Eng : I am on leave tomorrow\nKan : naanu naaLe rajeyalli ideeni
Eng : Cricket Match is there on day after tomorrow\nKan : Cricket match naaDiddu ide
Eng : I went there yesterday\nKan : naanu alli ninne hogidde
Eng : He was here on day before yesterday\nKan : avanu monne illi idda
Eng : I had come that day\nKan : naanu aa dina bandidde
Eng : I am going for a movie this night\nKan : ee raatri, naanu movie ge hogutta iddeeni
Eng : I woke up at 7.30am in the morning today\nKan : naanu ivattu beLigge Elu vare gantege edde
Eng : I had lunch at 1:15pm today\nKan : naanu madhyaana ondu kaalige uta madide
Eng : We will have coffee at 4:45 pm\nKan : naavu naalku mukkalige coffee kudiyona
Eng : I will eat fruits\nKan : naanu haNNugaLu thinthini (Fruit - haNNu)
Eng : I will not eat fruits\nKan : naanu haNNugaLu thinnalla
Eng : I will come in evening\nKan : naanu evening(sanje) barthini
Eng : I will not come in the night\nKan : naanu raathri baralla
Eng : I will do that work\nKan : naanu aa work(kelasa) maaDthini
Eng : I will do that work\nKan : naanu aa kelasa maadthini
Eng : I will not do that work\nKan : naanu aa kelasa maaDalla
Eng : I will drink water\nKan : naanu neeru(water) kuDithini
Eng : I will not drink juice\nKan : naanu juice kuDiyalla
Eng : I will give your book tomorrow\nKan : naanu nimma pusthaka naaLe koDthini
Eng : I will not give your book\nKan : naanu nimma pusthaka koDalla
Eng : will sleep at 10 P.M\nKan : 10 ghanTege ge malagthini
Eng : I will not sleep today\nKan : naanu ivatthu malagalla
Eng : is that done?\nKan : adu aaytha?
Eng : It is not done\nKan : adu aagilla
Eng : is the work finished?\nKan : kelasa mugitha?
Eng : Work is not finished yet\nKan : kelasa innu(yet) mugidilla
Eng : What is your name?\nKan : ninna hesaru enu?
Eng : which is your place?\nKan : nimma ooru yaavudu?
Eng : I will go for that\nKan : naanu adakke hogthini.
Eng : I will go for this\nKan : naanu idakke hogthini

Eng : Are you an Indian? - Yes
 Are you a chef? - No
 Kan : neenu bhaaratheeyana? - Haudu
 neenu adige bhaTTana? - Illa
Eng : That is correct, This is incorrect\n Kan : adu sari, idu thappu
Eng : You look very beautiful\nKan : neevu thumba sundaravaagi kaaNutha ideera
Eng : He is very good man\nKan : avanu thumba oLLe manushya
Eng : He is a bad boy\nKan : avanu obba keTTa huduga
Eng : This place is very big\nKan : idu thumba doDDa ooru/jaaga
Eng : This room is very small\nKan : idu thumba saNNa room
Eng : This stick is very long\nKan : ee kOlu(stick) thumba udda ide
Eng : She is a short girl / This is a short stick\nKan : avaLu giDDa hudugi / idu chikka kOlu
Eng : This site is very wide\nKan : ee site thumba agala ide
Eng : This is my new car\nKan : idu nanna hosa car
Eng : That is my old house\nKan : adu nanna haLe mane
Eng : He is elder to me\nKan : avaru nanage hiriyaru
Eng : She is younger to me\nKan : avaLu nanage kiriyaLu
Eng : This cloth is very thick\nKan : ee baTTe(cloth) thumba dappa ide
Eng : This paper is very thin\nKan : ee paper thumba theLLagide
Eng : please listen to my words\nKan : dayaviTTU nanna maathu kELu
Eng : Can you read this message?\nKan : neevu ee message Odutheera?
Eng : I am writing\nKan : naanu bariyuttha idini
Eng : Can we talk for 2 minutes?\nKan : naavu eraDu nimisha(minutes) maathu aadabahuda?
Eng : Enough doing this work\nKan : ee kelasa madiddu saaku
Eng : Stop talking\nKan : maathu nillisi (Stop - Nillu)
Eng : I will start writing\nKan : naanu bareyalu shuru maduthEne
Eng : This is my first car\nKan : idu nanna modala car
Eng : That was my last mistake\nKan : adu nanna koneya thappu
Eng : That work is difficult\nKan : aa kelasa kashTa
Eng : This work is easy!\nKan : ee kelasa sulabha!
Eng : please get up\nKan : dayaviTTu mEle ELi
Eng : Please come down\nKan : dayaviTTU keLage banni
Eng : Go front and go left\nKan : munde hogi matthu eDagaDe hogi
Eng : Orion mall is on right side of World Trade Building\nKan : Orion Mall World Trade Building na balagaDe ide
Eng : I have parked my car infront of my house\nKan : naanu nanna car annu nanna mane munde park maadidini
Eng : Take a step backward\nKan : ondu hejje(step) hinde thagoLi
Eng : Go further for 1 KM and turn left\nKan : 1(ondu) km munde hOgi eDagaDe thirugi
Eng : Please take this box.\nKan : dayaviTTU ee box thagoLi
Eng : Please bring that book tomorrow\nKan : dayaviTTu aa pushtakavanna naaLe thagonDu BANNI/BA
Eng : Go straight and take right\nKan : nEra hogi balagaDe thirugi
Eng : I am near Mekhri circle\nKan : naanu Mekhri vruthada hatthira iddeeni
Eng : My time is very good today\nKan : ivatthu nanna samaya thumba channagi ide
Eng : I came late today\nKan : naanu ivatthu thaDavaagi bande
Eng : I came early today\nKan : naanu ivatthu bEga bande
Eng : Show me the way\nKan : nanage daari thorisi
Eng : Right side of the road\nKan : rastheya balagaDe
Eng : Please Get out!\nKan : dayaviTTU horage hOgi
Eng : Please come in!\nKan : dayaviTTU oLage banni
Eng : My house is near to your house\nKan : Nanna mane nimma manege hatthira ide
Eng : Electronic City is very far from Vijayanagar\nKan : Electronic City VijayaNagar inda thumba doora
Eng : I love my family a lot\nKan : naanu nanna kuTumbavannu thumba ishTa paduthEne
Eng : My mother cooks very well\nKan : nanna amma thumba channagi adige maaduthaare
Eng : My father is a doctor\nKan : nanna appa obba doctor
Eng : He is my son\nKan : avanu nanna maga
Eng : She is my daughter\nKan : avaLu nanna magaLu
Eng : I have two children/KIDS\nKan : nanage ibbaru makkaLu
Eng : My brother(Elder) is a Software Engineer\nKan : nanna aNNa obba Software Engineer
Eng : My brother(Younger) is a Civil Engineer\nKan : nanna thamma obba Civil Engineer
Eng : My sister(Elder) is a teacher\nKan : nanna akka obba teacher
Eng : My sister(Younger) is a dancer\nKan : nanna thangi obba dancer
Eng : My mother-in-law is a housewife\nKan : nanna athe obba gruhiNi(housewife)
Eng : My father-in-law is a retired police man\nKan : nanna maava obba retired police
Eng : I like my grand father very much\nKan : nanna ajja andare nanage thumba ishTa
Eng : I stay with my grand mother\nKan : naanu nanna ajji jothe(with/together) ideeni
Eng : My grand son is in Bengaluru\nKan : nanna mommaga Bengalurinalli idaane
Eng : My grand daughter is studying M.Sc\nKan : nanna mommagaLu M.Sc Odutha idaaLe
Eng : My mother cooks very well\nKan : nanna amma thumba channagi aDige maaduthaare
Eng : I want water\nKan : nanage neeru bEku

string-array.name: Day9_content
string-array.item: Pooja: Hi Ganesh, How are you?
Ganesh: Hi Pooja, I am fine. And you?
Pooja: I am a software engineer. And you?
Pooja: Good. Which is your place?
Ganesh: My place is Sirigere near Holalkere. And yours?
Ganesh: Nice. Where do you stay in Bengaluru?
Ganesh: Same here. See you again

string-array.name: Day9_content_kannada
string-array.item: Ganesh: Hi Pooja, chennagi ideeni. Neevu?
Pooja: naanu obba Software engineer. neevu?
Ganesh: nanna ooru Sirigere, holalkere hatthira. nimmadu?
Pooja: ok. Nimmannu BhEti(meet) maadi khushi aaythu

string-array.name: Day10_content
string-array.item: Pooja: Will you come to Vijayanagar?
Pooja: It is too much. Will you come for 150 rupees?
Driver: Not possible madam. Atleast give 200.
Driver: Madam, We have reached Vijayanagar.
Pooja: Thank you. Please take this 500 rupees and give me change
Driver: Yes. Please send it through paytm only
Pooja: Thanks. I have sent it.

string-array.name: Day10_content_kannada
string-array.item: Pooja: thumba jaasthi aythu. 150 rupees ge barthira?
Driver: aagalla madam. hogli 200 rupees koDi.
Pooja: dhanyavaadagaLu. dayaviTTu ee 500 rupees thagoLi, chillare(change) koDi
Driver: ide. dayaviTTu paytm ge kaLuhisi.

string-array.name: anewmaid_content
string-array.item: Owner: Hmm. Where are you from?
Owner: Ok. How much salary should be given per month?
Maid: No madam. I work for 4 more houses and I take same amount there also.
Maid: We have to lead our life with this money. Please understand.
Owner: ok ok. You can come from 1st of next month.

string-array.name: anewmaid_content_kannada
string-array.item: Owner: Sari. ondu thingaLige eshtu duddu tagothira?
Maid: kEvala eraDu saavira rupees madam.
Maid: illa madam. Naanu innu 4 manegalalli kelasa madtini. alli kooda ashte duddu tagotini.
Maid: Naavu ee duddalli jeevana madabeku. Dayavittu artha madikolli
Owner: sari sari. mundina thingaLu 1st inda ba.

string-array.name: aregularmaid_content
string-array.item: Owner: Why did you come late today?
Maid: Took time in other house madam.
Owner: You always say one or the other reason for being late.
Maid: Sorry madam, Nothing like that.
Owner: hmm. Dont repeat this again.
Owner: Tomorrow there is a festival. Come early.
Maid: No madam. Not possible. We also have Pooja at home.
Owner: Ok. Take this month salary.
Maid: Thank you madam. What about festival bonus?
Owner: Will not give extra money. I will give you a new saree for the festival.
Maid: ok madam, Thank you. See you tomorrow.

string-array.name: aregularmaid_content_kannada
string-array.item: Owner: ivattu yaake late aagi bande?
Maid: innondu maneyalli time aytu madam.
Owner:late aagi bandaaga Eno ondu reason(kaaraNa) heLtiya.
Owner: hmm. matte idanna repeat (matthomme) madbeda.
Owner: Naale habba ide. bEga baa.
Maid: illa madam. aagalla. namma maneloo pooje ide.
Owner: sari. ee thingalina sambaLa thogo.
Maid: dhanyavada madam. habba da bonus koDtira?
Owner: extra duDDu koDalla. Habbakke hosa seere koDtini.
Maid: sari madam, dhanyavaadagaLu. naale sigoNa.

string-array.name: afriend_content
string-array.item: Pooja: Hi Ganesh, How are you?
Ganesh: Hi Pooja, I am fine. And you?
Pooja: I am a software engineer. And you?
Pooja: Good. Which is your place?
Ganesh: My place is Sirigere near Holalkere. And yours?
Ganesh: Nice. Where do you stay in Bengaluru?
Ganesh: Same here. See you again

string-array.name: afriend_content_kannada
string-array.item: Ganesh: Hi Pooja, chennagi ideeni. Neevu?
Pooja: naanu obba Software engineer. neevu?
Ganesh: nanna ooru Sirigere, holalkere hatthira. nimmadu?
Pooja: ok. Nimmannu BhEti(meet) maadi khushi aaythu

string-array.name: autocabdriver_content
string-array.item: Pooja: Will you come to Vijayanagar?
Pooja: It is too much. Will you come for 150 rupees?
Driver: Not possible madam. Atleast give 200.
Driver: Madam, We have reached Vijayanagar.
Pooja: Thank you. Please take this 500 rupees and give me change
Driver: Yes. Please send it through paytm only
Pooja: Thanks. I have sent it.

string-array.name: autocabdriver_content_kannada
string-array.item: Pooja: thumba jaasthi aythu. 150 rupees ge barthira?
Driver: aagalla madam. hogli 200 rupees koDi.
Pooja: dhanyavaadagaLu. dayaviTTu ee 500 rupees thagoLi, chillare(change) koDi
Driver: ide. dayaviTTu paytm ge kaLuhisi.

string-array.name: busconductor_content
string-array.item: Passenger: Sir, one ticket to whitefield
Passenger: I dont have change sir.
Conductor: Ok. take this 20 rupees. ask 7 rupees later.
Passenger: Ok. Please tell me when whitefield stop comes. I am new to bengaluru.
Passenger: Sir, give change of 7 rupees.

string-array.name: busconductor_content_kannada
string-array.item: Passenger: sir, whitefield ge ondu ticket koDi
Conductor: sari. ee ipatthu rupees thagoLi. Elu rupees amele kELi.
Passenger: Sari. dayavittu whitefield stop bandaga hELi. naanu bengalurige hosabalu.
Passenger: Sir, ELu rupees chillare kODi.

string-array.name: vendor_content
string-array.item: Vendor: Good morning sir. How are you?
Vendor: Good. What do you want sir?
Customer: Dont you have any better than this?
Vendor: These are good only sir. Take it.
Customer: ok give me half kg.
Customer: Give me coriander for 5 rs.
Vendor: Coriander is costly sir. Cant give for 5 rs. Shall i give for 10 rs?
Customer: ok give. what else to do
Vendor: ok sir. Take coconut sir. they are very good.
Customer: Not required now. How much is green chilli?
Vendor: 60 rupees kg sir. how much shall I give?
Vendor: ok sir. 45 rupees total. What else?
Customer: thats enough. take this 50 rupees.
Vendor: thank you sir. Take this 5 rupees change.

string-array.name: vendor_content_kannada
string-array.item: Vendor: nalavattu rupees ondu kilo ge sir.
Customer: aidu rupees ge kottambari soppu koDi.
Vendor: kottambari dubaari sir. aidu rupees ge baralla. 10 rupees ge kodla?
Customer: sari kodi. innEnu madakke agatte?
Vendor: sari sir. thengina kaayi thagoLi sir. thumba channagi ide.
Customer: eega avashyakathe illa. hasiru meNasinakaayi eshTu?
Vendor: aravattu rupees kilo ge sir. eshtu kodli?
Vendor: sari sir. nalavatta aidu rupees aytu. InnEnu bEku sir?
Customer: ashte saaku. ee aivattu rupees thagoLi.
Vendor: dhanyavaadagaLu sir. ee aidu rupees chillare thagoLi.

string-array.name: deliveryboy_content
string-array.item: DB: Hi Madam, I am calling from Pizza Bhat.
DB: I am near DMart. Where should I come?
Customer: Come straight for half km and then take left near ganesha temple.
DB: Ok madam. I will come in 10 minutes
DB: Hi madam, Please take your pizza. Check if it is hot.
Customer: It is hot. Thank you and I have already paid for this online
DB: Yes madam. Thank you for buying from Pizza Bhat. Enjoy pizza

string-array.name: deliveryboy_content_kannada
string-array.item: DB: Namaskara madam. Naanu Pizza Bhat inda call madta ideeni.
DB: naanu DMart hathira ideeni. naanu ellige barabEku?
Customer: munde banni arda km matte ganesha devasthaana hattira left thagoLi
DB: sari madam. Naanu hatthu nimishadalli bartini.
DB: namaskara madam. dayavittu nimma pizza thagoLi. bisi idiya check maadi.
Customer: bisi ide, dhanyavaadagaLu. matte naanu idakke online alli agale pay madidini.
DB: haudu madam. Pizza bhat inda khareedisidakke dhanyavaadagaLu. Pizza enjoy maaDi.

string-array.name: askdirections_content
string-array.item: Harshitha is in Mekhri circle and she wants directions to Manyatha tech park.
Harshitha: Hi sir, how to go to Manyatha tech park?
Helper: Hi madam, Go straight till hebbal flyover and take narrow road on the left.
Helper: Dont take any diversions, keep right and you will join outer ring road.
Harshitha: Sure. I think its a few kilometers further straight from there right?
Helper: Exactly. You will get manyatha tech park on the right side after veerannapalya flyover.
Harshitha: Thank you so much sir.

string-array.name: askdirections_content_kannada
string-array.item: harshitha Mekhri vruthadalli iddaaLe. Avalige Manyatha tech park ge hogalu daari tiLiyabEku
Harshitha: Namaskara sir, Manyatha tech park ge hEge hogbEku?
Helper: Namaskara madam, nEra hogi hebbal flyover sigatte, matte eDagaDe alli iro chikka road thagoLi
Helper: ellu kooda diversion tagobEDi, balagaDe iri, outer ring road join agtira
Harshitha: Khanditha, allinda swalpa kilometers munde ansatte alwa?
Helper: Exactly, manyatha tech park balagaDe siggate veerannapalya flyover adamEle.

resources.string: Eng:
Kan:
Description
Example
Say a word in English...
Bug Report/Feedback
Instant Word Translation (IWT)
Eng : you go\nKan : neenu HOGU(singular), neevu HOGI(plural)
Eng : that is for you\nKan : adu NINAGE(singular), adu NIMAGE(plural)
Eng : this is yours\nKan : idu NINNADU(singular), idu NIMMADU(plural)
Eng : you go there\nKan : NEENU(singular) allige hogu, NEEVU(plural) allige HOGI
Eng : you come\nKan : neenu BAA(singular), neevu BANNI(plural)

About Karnataka
About HithAM

what\'s this?

"This feature helps you learn most frequently used verbs in kannada and it's tenses. 

How to use?
Just click on the "CLICK HERE" button and voila! you will be shown a new verb with it's past, present and future tenses. 
Click on any of the cards to listen to the audio message!
Missing in my Vocabulary!
Oops! I am too young for sentences. But wait!
Oops! I am too young for sentences.
Show me
Sorry! I don\'t know that yet.

\tSoftware Engineer by profession, bike rider by passion. Listen to him as auto driver and a friend under conversations category.

Connect with HithAM
\t Software Engineer by profession, classical musician by passion. She would love to dance and play sports! Listen to her voice as owner in owner-maid conversations.
Samraddha
\tSoftware Engineer by profession, adventurist by passion! Listen to his voice as conductor, vendor etc under conversations.
